文献ID: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_006_chunk1
证据片段: nodular attack of α-annealed Zircaloy-2 and Zircaloy-4 in steam at 500°C

文献ID: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_006_chunk1
证据片段: β quenched Zircaloy-2 showed the opposite behavior, suffering nodular corrosion in hydrogen-free steam

文献ID: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_006_chunk1
证据片段: Nodules did initiate on Ozhenite-0.5, but did not develop into serious localized attack for α-annealed material

文献ID: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_006_chunk1
证据片段: Alloys with higher niobium content and Valoy were independent of hydrogen in the steam and they never suffered localized corrosion

文献ID: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_006_chunk1
证据片段: The chromium-rich particles in Valoy did not influence the oxidation of the matrix adjacent to the particles under hydrogenated conditions

文献ID: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_006_chunk1
证据片段: The iron-rich particles in the Zircaloys and in Ozhenite-0.5 decreased the oxidation of matrix in a region around each particle

文献ID: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_006_chunk1
证据片段: cladding tubes were split longitudinally and rolled to strips with a cold reduction of about 40 percent

文献ID: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_006_chunk1
证据片段: All materials were tested in two heat treatment conditions: cold worked and recrystallized at 600°C and slowly cooled (30°C/h) from 900°C

文献ID: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_006_chunk1
STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_006_chunk1
证据片段: In addition Zircaloy-2 was tested in a β quenched condition. The β quenching was done from 1100°C in a vertical vacuum furnace from which the tubes were dropped into water within a second
